result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody G. Badham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs are due in full by 07/18/2022 or may arrange for a payment plan before the 60 day deadline.  Failure to pay any part of the court costs in full by the due date will result in 30 days in jail.

Bond on file applied.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody G. Badham

Pre-trial conference on May 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waive reading of the complaint.  Defense stood mute/entered NGP.  NGP entered by the court on the defendant's behalf.  PTC set for 5/11 and STC set for 5/23 @ 3 pm.
Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver.  Defendant stated he understood.  Court found that defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to attorney.
9:29 AM Defendant Cody G. Badham appeared by video.  Attorney Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin. Warrant quashed.

8:33 AM    Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Cody G. Badham not in court. Judge Diehn hearing for Judge Becker. State requesting AWA. AWA authorized by the Court.
mailed attorney waiver to defendant on this date. JMS

Adjourned initial appearance on April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. 
No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly conduct.

9:15 AM Defendant Cody G. Badham appeared by video, Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Court explained his attorney rights. He will hire own attorney.  AIA set for 3/28 at 9 am.
